meanings.definition: Closely connected or appropriate to the matter at hand.
meanings.sent1: The information she shared was very relevant to our discussion.
meanings.sent2: It is important to focus on relevant details when solving a problem.
meanings.sent3: The cat's interest in the fish tank was quite relevant to its playful nature.
meanings.sent4: Her experience in marketing proved to be relevant in navigating the new project.
meanings.sent5: The key to success is to always keep the most relevant information in mind.

meanings.definition: Having significant and demonstrable bearing on the matter at hand.
meanings.sent1: The witness provided relevant evidence that helped solve the case.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's research findings were highly relevant to the study of climate change.
meanings.sent3: The clown's oversized shoes were surprisingly relevant to his comedic act.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a relevant map guiding us through the complex issue.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's feedback was so relevant that it greatly improved my understanding.
